name: treatment of used flexible duct, aluminium/PET, DN of 125 | used flexible duct aluminium/PET, DN of 125 | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8579/documentation

Disposal of a flexible tube made of PET, laminated with aluminium foil and strengthened with galvanised steel spiral wire. Weight 0.205 kg/m;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

Transport to dismantling facilities, machines for handling in sorting plant, electricity demand for sorting plant, final disposal of waste material. Cut-off to recycling for metals.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Amount of material investigated in 2003. Disposal technology mix as used in late 1990ies
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Specific to the technology mix encountered in sorting plants in Switzerland
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Disposal to a sorting plant assumed. Metal pieces and copper in cables and electronic devices are recycled, plastic parts are incinerated, inert wastes (e.g. rock wool) are landfilled.
